div1.p: CANADA PROVINCE OF SASKATCHEWAN
I, John William McLeod, of the City of Regina in the Province of Saskatchewan, Clerk of the Executive Council of the Province of Saskatchewan
Solemnly declare:-

1. That I am now and have been since March 1st A.D. 1910, Clerk of the Executive Council for the Province of Saskatchewan, and as such am by law entrusted with the custody of the records of the appointment of the Acting Deputy Attorney General in said Province.

2. That the appointment of the Acting Deputy Attorney General was made by order of the Lieutenant Governor in Council and that the record of such appointment is kept by me in my office and us under my custody and control.

3. That annexed hereto and marked Exhibit "A" to this Declaration is a certified copy of the order of the Lieutenant Governor in Council appointing Malcolm Dingwall as Acting Deputy Attorney General in and for the Province of Saskatchewan.

4. That annexed hereto and marked Exhibit "B" to this Declaration is a copy of The Saskatchewan Gazette of November 30th, A.D. 1918, containing notice of the appointment of the said Malolm Dingwall as Acting Deputy Attorney General, aforesaid.
AND I MAKE this solemn declaration conscientiously believing it to be true and knowing that it is of the same force and effect as if made under oath and by virtue of "THE CANADA EVIDENCE ACT."
Declared before me at the City of Regina in the Province of Saskatchewan, Canada, this twelfth day of August, A.D. 1921.
(signed) J.W. McLeod Clerk of the Executive Council.
(signed)(seal) W.J. Windeall A Notary Public in and for the Province of Saskatchewan.
NOTARY PUBLIC. Missionexpires December 31st, 1921
Certified Copy of a Minute of the Executive Council of Saskatchewan,dated at Regina on Monday, the eighteenth day of November, 1918, and approved by His Honour the Lieutenant Governor.

Upon the recommendation of the Attorney-General, dated November 15, 1918, the Executive Council advises, under the provisions of the Civil Service Act in that behalf, the appointment of Malcolm Dingwall, Esquire, Barrister, of Regina, a Law Officer of the Department of the Attorney-General, as Acting Deputy Attorney-General; the said appointment to take effect on, from and after the twelfth day of November, 1918.
(Signed) J.W. McLeod Clerk of the Executive Council.
EXECUTIVE COUNCIL. OFFICE. AUG 12 1921. REGINA SASKATCHEWAN.
This is the Exhibit marked "A" referred to in the Declaration of John William McLeod, taken before me thsi twelfth day of August,A.D. 1921.
(signed) W.J. Windeall (seal) A Notary Public, etc.
NOTARY PUBLIC. My commission expires December 31st, 1921
The Saskatchewan Gazette
Vol. XIV Published by Authority No. 22
REGINA, SATURDAY, NOVEMBER, 30, 1918
APPOINTMENTS.
His Honour the Lieutenant Governor by and with the advice of the Executive Council had been pleased to make the following appointments:
JUSTICES OF THE PEACE
Regina, Saturday, October 5, 1918. John Auchmuty, of Sedley. Sidney Appleby, of Sutherland.
Regina, Tuesday, Ovtober 15, 1918. William James Coleman, of Vanguard.
Regina, Monday, October 21, 1918. Adolph D. Bakke, of Overland. William Forrest Halpenny, of Noremae.
Regina, Monday, November 4, 1918. Luther Hudson Wallace, of Estuary.
Regina, Tuesday, November 5, 1918. Harry George Johnston, of Cabri.
NOTARIES PUBLIC.
Regina, Thursday, November 14, 1918. Edwin Jones, of Regina. Edwad Cecil Gilliat, of Saskatoon.

Regina, Monday, November 18, 1918. Louis Demay, of St. Brieux. Harold Henry V. Harford, of Leader. Neil Rutherford, of Central Butte. Judson McEwan Sinclair, of Milden. Thomas Richard Vause, of Kandahar.
COMMISSIONERS FOR OATHS

Regina, Thursday, November 14, 1918. Joseph Arthur Laporte, of Regina. Emett Matthew Hall, of Saskatoon. John Calvert Martin, of Scott. George Elisha Van Blaricom, of Wilkie. Vernon Orvall Peters, of Saskatoon.
Regina, Monday, November 18, 1918. Richard Henry Buchanan, of Kendal. Percy Watkins James, of Moose Jaw. James Robert Lowery, of Lloydminster.
div1.note: This is Exhibit marked "B" referred to in the Declaration of John William McLeod, taken before me this twelfth day of August A.D. 1921. (signed)(seal) W.J. Windeall A Notary Public, etc.
NOTARY PUBLIC. My commission expires December 31, 1921.
div1.p: David Harvey Lunam, of Regina. Joseph Lee, of Regina. Edgar Burton Linnell, of Theress. Walter Scott McMillan, of Kamsack. Hector Gillies MacLean, of Saskatoon. Carl Ferdnand Moerike, of Dummer. Hernan William Schuler, of Denzil. Margaret Russell B. Stewart, of Moose Jaw. George St. John Van-Hallen, of Verwood.
ACTING DEPUTY ATTORNEY GENERAL.
Regina, Monday, November 18, 1918. Malcolm Dingwall, of Regina.
DEPUTY REGISTRATION CLERKS.
Regina, Monday, November 18, 1918. Fanny Torson, for the Judicial District of Cypress. Bruce J. Ennis, for the Judicial District of Cypress.
ISSUERS OF MARRIAGE LICENSES.
Regina, Friday, November 8, 1918. A.J. Boyer of Montmartre.
Regina, Thursday, November 14, 1918. C.M. Long, of Morse.
DIRECTOR OF RURAL EDUCATION ASSOCIATIONS AND SCHOOL FAIRS.
Regina, Thursday, November 14, 1918. Frederick Wellington Bates, B.A., M.Sc., of Saskatoon.
ADMINISTRATOR OF ESTATES OF DECEASED SOLDIERS.
Regina, Friday, November 15, 1918. Samuel Quigg, of Regina.
PROVINCIAL POLICE FORCE.

Regina, Monday, November 18, 1918. Stanley Harvey Bush, as corporal. James Bell, as corporal. Havelock Percy Wheatley, as constable. Joseph Emery Sabourin, as constable Jacob Van Wingerden, as constable. Frank Black, as constable. Robert Reuben Scotney, as constable.
Under the provisions of The Game Act the Minister of Agriculture has been pleased to make the following appointment:
VOLUNTARY GAME GUARDIAN.
Regina, Thursday, November 21, 1918. Alexander Kimak, of Hafford.
RESIGNATIONS AND RETIREMENTS.
Regina, Friday, November 15, 1918. John Duncan Cameron, of Regina; administrator of states of deceased soldiers.

Regina, Monday, November 18, 1918. Joseph Bradner; corporal of the provincial police force. Charles Edward Berkley; constable of the provincial police force. Alphonse Emil Gustav Haazen; constable of the provincial police force.
SITTINGS OF THE COURT OF KING'S BENCH.
Sittings of the Court of King's Bench for Saskatchewan for the year 1919, presided over by a single judge, shall be held at 10 o'clock in the forenoon at the following time and places:

January 7 - Prince Albert (Criminal). 7 - Yorkton (Criminal). 7- Battleford (Criminal). 7- Regina (Civil). 7- Wynyard. 7- Shaunavon. 7- Kerrobert. 7- Kindersley. 21- Arcola. 21- Moosomin. 21- Gravelbourg. 28- Regina (Criminal). 28- Moose Jaw (Criminal). 28- Saskatoon (Criminal).
February 4- Swift Current. 4- Battleford (Civil). 11- Prince Albert (Civil). 18 - Estevan. 25- Melville. 25- Saskatoon (Civil).
March 4 - Yorkon (Civil). 11- Moose Jaw (Civil). 18 - Scott. 18- Humboldt. 25- Weyburn.
April 1 - Wynyard. 8- Regina (Civil). 8- Yorkton. 22- Battleford. 22- Saskatoon (Civil).
May 13- Regina (Criminal). 13- Moose Jaw (Criminal). 13- Saskatoon (Criminal). 13- Kindersley. 13- Arcola.
May 20 - Shaunavon. 20 - Keerobert.
June 4- Prince Albert. 4- Swift Current. 4- Moonsomin. 4- Gravelbourg. 17- Regina (Civil). 17- Moose Jaw (Civil). 17- Saskatoon (Civil).
September 30 - Regina (Civil). 30- Moose Jaw (Civil). 30- Saskatoon (Civil). 30- Melville. 30- Estevan.
October 14- Swift Current. 14- Humboldt. 21- Weyburn. 21- Scott.
November 4- Regina (Criminal). 4- Moose Jaw (Criminal). 4-Saskatoon (Criminal). 4- Prince Albert. 4- Shaunavon. 4- Wynyard. 11- Battleford. 18 - Yorkton. 18- Kindersley. 25- Gravelbourg.
December 2- Regina (Civil). 2 - Moose Jaw (Civil). 2- Saskatoon (Civil). 2- Arcola. 9- Kerrobert. 9- Moosomin.
The following courts fixed for November and December, 1918, are respectively adjourned to the regular sittings for 1919 as above fixed, as follows:

Regina (Criminal), November 5, 1918, to January 28, 1919. Moose Jaw (Criminal), November 5, 1918, to Jaunary 28, 1919. Saskatoon (Criminal), November 5, 1918, to January 28, 1919. Wynyard, November 5, 1918, to January 7, 1919. Kindersley, November 5, 1918, to January 7, 1919. Shaunavon, November 5, 1918, to January 7, 1919. Battleford, November 12, 1918 (to January 7, 1919, as to criminal cases; to February 4, 1919, as to civil cases). Yorkton, November 19, 1918 (to January 7, 1919, as to criminal cases; to March 4, 1919, as to civil cases). Regina (Civil), November 26, 1918, to January 7, 1919. Saskatoon (Civil), November 26, 1918, to February 25, 1919. Prince Albert, November 26, 1918 (to January 7, 1919, as to criminal cases; to February 11, 1919, as to civil cases). Kerrobert, December 3, 1918, to January 7, 1919. Gravelbourg, December 3, 1918, to January 21, 1919. Moosomin, December 10, 1918, to January 21, 1919. Arcola, December 10, 1918, to January 21, 1919.
Promulgated this twenty-fifth day of November, 1918.
Certified a true copy, J.M. CARTHEW Acting Registrar.
(Sgd.) J.T. BROWN, C.J. (Sgd.) JAS MCKAY, J (Sgd.) H.Y. MACDONALD, J. (Sgd.) H.V. BIGELOW, J. (Sgd.)GEO. E. TAYLOR, J.
ORDERS IN COUNCIL.
REGULATIONS UNDER THE THEATRES AND CINEMATOGRAPHS ACT.
Regina, Saturday, November 9, 1918.

Under the provisions of The Theatres and Cinematographs Act His Honour the Lieutenant Governor by and with the advice of the Executive Council has been pleased to order that certain regulations governing theatres, public halls, film exchanges and moving picture machines promulgated by Order made in Council on the twenty-seventh day of February, 1918, be amended by striking out sections 3, 5, 6, 12, 28, 38 and 39 and substitute the following therefor:

3. In the third line from the end of the section beginning with the words "but where iron lined cabinets are used" strike out all words to the end of the section and substitute therefor the following: "The floors of all cabinets shall be lined throughout with a proper insulating covering."

5. In the fourth line strike out the words beginning "Each of these openings" and ending with the words, in the seventh line, "and of such weight" and substitute therefor the following: "The opening for observation by the operator shall not be more than 12 inches wide by 18 inches deep, and the one for projecting the picture upon the screen shall not be more than 8 inches wide by 12 inches deep. Each of these openings shall be provided with a fireproof gravity door made of not less than 12 gauge iron and shall slide in smooth square cornered grooves."
In the eleventh line of this section substitute 24 instead of 18, and in the eighth line from the end of the section substitute 20 for 12.

6. In the fifth line strike out the words beginning "Films in the cabinet not in the magazine" and ending "having tight fitting covers," and substitute therefor the following: "All films in the cabinet not in the magazine of the machine shall be kept in a box having a close fitting, hinged, self-closing cover, made throughout of metal not less than 16 gauge, having all joints closely riveted together."
12. In the line next the last one substitute the word "wall" instead of the word "floor."
28. At the end of the section add:

"(a) Every film exchange upon payment of the prescribed fee shall receive a license but no license shall be issued to a film exchange which is an incorporated company unless it is registered under the Companies Act of this province."
38. In the second line instead of the word "twenty" substitute the word "eighteen."

39. Beginning with the words "and by itinerant exhibitors" in the ninth line of the paragraph immediately following subsection (6) strike out the remainder of the section and substitute therefor the following: "Second class operators shall be eligible for employment only in theatres in towns and villages and by itinerant exhibitors, and as assistants to first class operators, and third class operators only in theatres in villages and as assisstants to second class operators."
J.W. MCLEOD Clerk Executive Council.
Regina, Saturday, November 9, 1918.

Under the provisions of The Theatres and Cinematographs Act His Honour the Lieutenant Governor by and with the advice of the Executive Council has been pleased to order that that portion of the Table of Fees of the above mentioned Act which reads as follows:
"In Cities.- Every concert hall, dance hall or assembly room, or other place of public entertainment, free;
"In Towns.- Every concert hall, dance hall or assembly room, or other place of public entertainment, free;
"In Cities.- Every concert hall, dance hall or assembly room, or other place of public entertainment, $2;
"In Towns.- Every concert hall, dance hall or assembly room, or other place of public entertainment, $1;
"In Villages.- Every concert hall, dance hall or assembly room, or other place of public entertainment, $1;

"Provided that every concert hall, dance hall or assembly room or other place of public entertainment that is used by an itinerant exhibitor for the exhibition of moving pictures the annual license fee shall be:
"In cities, $5; in towns, $2; in villages $2."
His Honour the Lieutenant Governor further orders that the provisions of the amending cluases come into effect on and from the first day of January, 1919.
J.W. MCLEOD Chief Executive Council.
REGULATIONS GOVERNING PUBLIC HEALTH.
Regina, Tuesday, November 12, 1918.

Under the provisions of The Public Health Act His Honour the Lieutenant Governor by and with the advice of the Executive Council has been pleased to advise that the Order made in Council on the first day of November, 1918, approvign certain regulations respecting the prevention of the transportation of dead bodies and the use of face masks be rescinded.
J.W. MCLEOD Clerk Executive Council.
LICENSE FEES UNDER THE COMPANIES ACT.
Regina, Thursday, November 14, 1918.

Under the provisions of section 27 of The Companies Act His Honour the Lieutenant Governor by and with the advice of the Executive Council has been pleased to order that the license fee of ten dollards be paid to the Registrar of Joint Stock Companies by all mutual insurance companies registered under the said Act.
J.W. MCLEOD Clerk Executive Council.
REGULATIONS GOVERNING PURCHASE OF LIVE STOCK.
Regina, Thursday, November 14, 1918.

Under the provisions of section 15 of The Live Stock Purchase and Sale Act His Honour the Lieutenant Governor by and with the advice of the Executive Council has been pleased to order the approval of the following regulations:

Applications received from returned soldiers and residents of the free range area for the purchase of heifers and milch cows will be filled in preference to applications from residents of other parts of Saskatchewan.
J.W. MCLEOD Clerk Executive Council.
THE LAND TITLES ACT.
Regina, Monday, November 18, 1918.

Under the provisions of subsection (1) of section 13 of The Land Titles Act His Honour the Lieutenant Governor by and with the advice of the Executive Council has been pleased to order that all officials called assistant deputy registrars of land titles and who have acted in such capacity until the present time, be and the same are hereby appointed deputy registrars of land titles; the said appointments to take effect on, from and after the first day of May, 1918.
J.W. MCLEOD Clerk Executive Council.
GOVERNMENT NOTICES.
SCHOOL DISTRICTS EMPOWERED TO BORROW MONEY.
Regina, Wednesday, October 20, 1918.

Notice is hereby given in accordance with the provisions of The School Act and of The Local Government Board Act in that behalf that the Local Government Board has authorised the board of trustees of the STorthoaks P.S. School District No. 2 of Saskatchewan to borrow the sum of twenty-five hundred dollars upon the security of the said district for the purpose of erecting and equipping a school building and purchasing site (debentures to be repayable in ten equal consecutive annual instalments of principal and interest combined, interest at not exceeding 8 per cent. per annum).
Treasurer's address: W.C. Rightmyer, Storthoaks.
THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT BOARD, GEORGE A. BELL, Chairman.
Regina, Wednesday, October 30, 1918.

Notice is hereby given in accordance with the provisions of The School Act and of The Local Government Board Act in that behalf that the Local Government Board has authorised the board of trustees of the Gergovia School District No. 4064 of Saskatchewan to borrow the sum of two thousand dollars upon the security of the said district for the purpose of erecting and equipping school house (debentures to be repayable in ten equal conecutive annual instalments of principal and interest combined, with interest at a rate not exceeding 8 per cent. per annum).
Treasurer's address: John E. Verry, Gergovia
THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT BOARD, GEORGE A. BELL, Chairman.
Regina, Wednesday, October 30, 1918.

Notice is hereby given in accordance with the provisions of The School Act and of The Local Government Board Act in that behalf that the Local Government Board has authorised the board of trustees of The Gumbo Flat School District No. 4086 of Saskatchewan to borrow the sum of twenty-five hundred dollars upon the security of the said district for the purpose of purchasing site, building and equipping school house and outbuildings (debentures to be repayable in ten equal consecutive annual instalments of principal and interest combined, interest at a rate not exceeding 8 per cent. per annum).
Treasurer's address: Wm. C. Inkster, Lucky Lake.
THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT BOARD, GEORGE A. BELL, Chairman.
Regina, Monday, November 4, 1918.

Notice is hereby given in accordance with the provisions of The School Act and of The Local Government Board Act in that behalf that the Local Government Board has authorised the board of trustees of The Willow Lake School District No. 2081 of Saskatchewan to borrow the sum of twelve hundred dollars upon the security of the said district for the purpose of erecting a teacher's residence (debentures to be repayable in ten equal consecutive annual instalments of principal and interest combined, interest at a rate not exceeding 8 per cent. per annum).
Treasurer's address: John A. McNevin, Dalmeny.
THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT BOARD, GEORGE A. BELL, Chairman.
Regina, Tuesday, November 5, 1918.

Notice is hereby given in accordance with the provisions of The School Act and of The Local Government Board Act in that behalf that the Local Government Board has authorised the board of trustees of The Barvas School District No. 3452 of Saskatchewan to borrow the sum of three hundred and fifty dollars upon the security of the said district for the purpose of purchasing school grounds, erecting addition to teacher's residence and an addition to the school house (debentures to be repayable in seven equal consecutive annual instalments of principal with interest, interest at not exceeding 8 per cent. per annum).
Treasurer's address: Thos. Jowsey, Barvas.
THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT BOARD, GEORGE A. BELL, Chairman.
Regina, Tuesday, November 5, 1918.

Notice is hereby given in accordance with the provisions of The School Act and of The Local Government Board Act in that behalf that the Local Government Board has authorised the board of trustees of The Light School District No. 2346 of Saskatchewan to borrow the sum of eight hundred dollars upon the security of said district for the purpose of erecting teacher's residence (debentures to be repayable in five equal consecutive annual instalments of principal with interest, interest at not exceeding 8 per cent. per annum).
Treasurer's address: Paul H. Serack, Perdue.
THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT BOARD, GEORGE A. BELL, Chairman.
Regina, Tuesday, November 5, 1918.

Notice is hereby given in accordance with the provisions of The School Act and of The Local Government Board Act in that behalf that the Local Government Board has authorised the board of trustees of The Dafoe School District No. 4038 of Saskatchewan to borrow the sum of twenty-five hundred dollars upon the security of the said district for the purpose of erecting and equipping school and outbuildings (debentures to be repayable in ten consecutive annual instalments of principal and interest combined, with interest at a rate not exceeding 8 per cent. per annum).
Treasurer's address: John S. MacKay, Dafoe.
THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT BOARD, GEORGE A. BELL, Chairman.
Regina, Tuesday, November 5, 1918.

Notice is hereby given in accordance with the provisions of The School Act and of The Local Government Board Act in that behalf that the Local Government Board has authorised the board of trustees of The Rosemary School District No. 4093 of Saskatchewan to borrow the sum of twenty-eight hundred dollars upon the security of the said district for the purpose of purchasing site, fencing same, erecting and equipping school house and stable (debetures to be repayable in ten equal consecutive annual instalments of principal with interest, interest at not more than 8 per cent. per annum).
Treasurer's address: John A. Brownlee, Unity.
THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT BOARD, GEORGE A. BELL, Chairman.
Regina, Wednesday, November 6, 1918.

Notice is hereby given in accordance with the provisions of The School Act and of The Local Government Board Act in that behalf that the Local Government Board has authorised the board of trustees of The Highcroft School District No. 2953 of Saskatchewan to borrow the sum of thirty-five hundred dollars upon the security of the said district for the purpose of erecting a first school (debentures to be repayable in ten equal consecutive annual instalments of principal with interest, interest at not exceeding 8 per cent. per annum).
Treasurer's address: Chas. Phee, Kincaid.
THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT BOARD, GEORGE A. BELL, Chairman.
INCORPORATION OF JOINT STOCK COMPANIES.
CANADA PROVINCE OF SASKATCHEWAN
I hereby certify that
